result.execSummary:
This case or charge(s) on this case have been reopened. After a case has been completed, the case or charge(s) can be reopened for a variety of reasons. The WCCA case record and court record events must be reviewed to determine the exact reasons that the case or charge(s) were reopened.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

01:42 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Willie R Cain in court, in custody, with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  The Court has hesitations moving forward today due to orders Judge Melvin recently put in place and has concerns about probable cause.  Court takes recess at 1:46 pm.  Case recalled at 1:54 pm.  Chelsea Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant Willie R Cain in court, in custody, with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.  Attorney Thompson states the defendant was in Court on March 18, 2022 when Judge Melvin placed the new conditions of bond in place.  Attorney Thompson places further arguments on the record.  The Court does not find probable cause and dismisses this action.  Court orders case dismissed.
